title: cmd/godoc: new godoc template: where are my packages ?
body:
by **milak.mlk**: 
I use godoc to see my source code documentation. The new weekly revision
(weekly.2012-02-14) contains a new template (much pretty) but i can't see links for my
packages. I can find them when i write manually the url but there is no link to find my
packages. The previous revision contained links in the right-top.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1.godoc -path="mypackagepath" -http=:8080
2.in browser : http://localhost:8080/ you can't see any link for packages except
http://localhost:8080/pkg/ that lists installed packages and standard packages
3.in browser : http://localhost:8080/pkg/mypackage i can find my package documentation

What is the expected output?
1.Have a link for my packages in the reference menu
(http://localhost:8080/doc/reference.html)
2.See my packages in the package list (http://localhost:8080/pkg/)

What do you see instead?


Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?


Which operating system are you using?
windows XP 32 bits

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)
weekly.2012-02-14

Please provide any additional information below.
